section.p: There are two ways to export dictionary data, within a folder in the internal format or as an external dictionary in SGML format.

Export a dictionary if you want to pass the dictionary on to other users or to create a backup copy of a dictionary. Protected dictionaries must be exported in a folder. For more information on folder export, see .
Exporting a dictionary into an SGML-based file is required if you want to use the dictionary data in environments other than .

dictionaryUnicode enablementExporting a dictionary can also be part of the conversion of a dictionary into Unicode. To convert a dictionary into Unicode, you must first export it from and then import it again. In both cases, you select SGML Unicode as export or import format.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Sufficient disk space for the exported dictionary is available.

Contains the name of the dictionary to be exported. You can overwrite it with a new name.
Select the format in which the dictionary is to be stored. Select SGML Unicode if the export is part of your conversion of the dictionary into Unicode.

section.p: Click Save to begin exporting the dictionary.
If you specified a new directory name, you are prompted to confirm whether you want to create this new directory.

section.title: Results
section.p: An SGML-based dictionary file is created at the specified location and can be given to other users or programs for further usage.
